intro: Pedicularis lineata var. dissecta, commonly known as the dissected lousewort, is a perennial herb native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant features a hairy stem with alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are finely dissected, giving it a feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
